root.name: add
tip: U: add [options] <package>[@<version>]
Add a package and any packages that it depends on
By default, any new package is installed as a prod dependency
E: add -D sass

options.name: --global
tip: U: -g, --global
Add a package globally

options.name: --save-dev
tip: U: -D, --save-dev
Install the specified packages as devDependencies

options.name: --save-exact
tip: U: -E, --save-exact
Saved dependencies will be configured with an exact version rather than using pnpm's default semver range operator

options.name: --save-optional
tip: U: -O, --save-optional
Install the specified packages as optionalDependencies

options.name: --save-peer
tip: Add one or more packages to peerDependencies and install them as dev dependencies

options.name: --save-prod
tip: U: -P, --save-prod
(Default)Install the specified packages as regular dependencies

options.name: --workspace
tip: Only adds the new dependency if it is found in the workspace

root.name: audit
tip: Checks for known security issues with the installed packages

root.name: cat-file
tip: Prints the contents of a file based on the hash value stored in the index file

root.name: cat-index
tip: Prints the index file of a specific package from the store

root.name: create
tip: Create a project from a create-* or @foo/create-* starter kit.
E: create vite@latest   --- create a vite project

next.name: vite@latest
tip: Create a vite project

next.name: vue@latest
tip: Create a vue project

root.name: exec
tip: Executes a shell command in scope of a project

root.name: find-hash
tip: Experimental! Lists the packages that include the file with the specified hash

root.name: import
tip: Generates a pnpm-lock.yaml from an npm package-lock.json (or npm-shrinkwrap.json) file

root.name: install
tip: U: install|i
Install all dependencies for a project

root.name: install-test
tip: U: install-test|it
Runs a pnpm install followed immediately by a pnpm test

root.name: licenses
tip: Check licenses in consumed packages

root.name: link
tip: U: link|ln
Connect the local project to another one

root.name: list
tip: U: list|ls
Print all the versions of packages that are installed, as well as their dependencies, in a tree-structure

options.name: --global
tip: U: -g, --global
List globally

root.name: outdated
tip: Check for outdated packages

root.name: pack
tip: Create a tarball from a package

root.name: prune
tip: Removes extraneous packages

root.name: publish
tip: Publishes a package to the registry

root.name: rebuild
tip: U: rebuild|rb
Rebuild a package

root.name: remove
tip: U: remove|rm
Removes packages from node_modules and from the projects package.json

options.name: --global
tip: U: -g, --global
Remove globally

root.name: root
tip: Prints the effective modules directory

root.name: run
tip: Runs a defined package script

root.name: start
tip: Runs an arbitrary command specified in the package's "start" property of its "scripts" object

root.name: store
tip: Reads and performs actions on pnpm store that is on the current filesystem

next.name: add
tip: Adds new packages to the pnpm store directly
Does not modify any projects or files outside the store

next.name: path
tip: Prints the path to the active store directory

next.name: prune
tip: Removes unreferenced (extraneous, orphan) packages from the store

options.name: --force
tip: If there are alien directories in the store, this command removes them
Alien directories are directories/files that were not created by the package manager

next.name: status
tip: Checks for modified packages in the store

root.name: test
tip: U: test|t
Runs a package's "test" script, if one was provided

root.name: unlink
tip: Unlinks a package. Like yarn unlink but pnpm re-installs the dependency after removing the external link

root.name: update
tip: U: update, up, upgrade
Update packages to their latest version based on the specified range
When used without arguments, updates all dependencies

options.name: --global
tip: U: -g, --global
Update globally

options.name: --help
tip: U: --help, -h
Print this help message

options.name: --version
tip: U: --version, -v
Print the current version of pnpm
